A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: The Last Jedi is a much more character-driven story than its predecessor\, just as The Empire Strikes Back was in 1980. It is also important to remember that this is Rey’s story\, not Luke’s. This movie is tailored to the new main characters and what events will challenge their growths\, and it accomplishes this better than any previous entry in the Saga. The development to Luke’s character and reveal of Rey’s parents are intentional choices to force her to forge her own path rather than use anybody else as a crutch. The Force Awakens showed that she was prone to making excuses to avoid making tough choices\, but The Last Jedi was her proverbial tossing from the nest\, and she flies so high. Finn’s side mission is also much more than a diversion. His character growth is profound as he begins by trying to run from the fight (still) and ends up correcting Phasma that he is “Rebel scum.” This is a beautiful movie that deserves at least a second viewing.
